metadata.synopsis: Philomeen is ready to die for her cause. She has run from the duergar with explosives and when the player arrives, she assumes they are a true soul and would sooner blow herself up than let the player take her to Moonrise.If you reach the end of her dialogue, she'll leave once you get far enough away.
metadata.how_to_trigger: Repro steps:1. Start the game.2. loadlevel WLD_Main_A3. use debug book - Go to region > Act 1 > UND > Panic Room4. Teleport through the Intricate Door (CTRL-Shift-T)5. Move towards Philomene.

2.speaker: Philomeen
2.text: Tell Laridda I'm dead. It's the best way.
2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep gnome conjures a fire in her hand.

201.speaker: Philomeen
201.text: Hold it. I swear to Ironhand, one more step and I blow us to chunks!
201.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep gnome conjures a fire in her hand.

209.text: Hold it. I swear to Ironhand, one more step and I blow us to chunks!
209.context: CinematicNodeContext: Deep gnome conjures a fire in her hand.

130.text: Hold it. I swear to Ironhand, one more step and I blow us to chunks!
130.context: NodeContext: Ready to blow you and her up.

45.speaker: Philomeen
45.text: Hold it. I swear to Ironhand, one more step and I blow us to chunks!
45.context: NodeContext: Ready to blow you and her up.

176.speaker: Narrator
176.text: *An ashen scent fills the air. The barrel is filled with smokepowder.*

152.speaker: Player
152.text: *But the scent is acrid, as if contaminated somehow. Or much, much more concentrated.*

146.text: *But the scent is acrid, as if contaminated somehow. Or much, much more concentrated.*

126.speaker: Narrator
126.text: *But the scent is acrid, as if contaminated somehow. Or much, much more concentrated.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text: Chk - the gnome's well and truly mad.
38.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to player companion.NodeContext: Hoon = outsider, an expletive of sorts. Pronounced like it is spelled.

55.speaker: Lae'zel
55.text: Chk - the gnome's well and truly mad.
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to player companion.NodeContext: Hoon = outsider, an expletive of sorts. Pronounced like it is spelled.

132.speaker: Shadowheart
132.text: Careful. I'd rather not have to pick bits of gnome from my hair.
132.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to player companion.NodeContext: Hoon = outsider, an expletive of sorts. Pronounced like it is spelled.

52.speaker: Karlach
52.text: She's gonna blow up. That's my thing.
52.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to player companion.NodeContext: Hoon = outsider, an expletive of sorts. Pronounced like it is spelled.

81.speaker: Philomeen
81.text: Shut your mouth, hoon, or I'll shut you down.
81.context: CinematicNodeContext: Said to player companion.NodeContext: Hoon = outsider, an expletive of sorts. Pronounced like it is spelled.

128.speaker: Narrator
128.text: Philomeen, I presume. What's going on here?
128.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Philomeen, I presume. What's going on here?
56.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

46.speaker: Philomeen
46.text: Drugh. Dropping my name like your cultist arse knows me. Like we're friends.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Hold on. There's something different about that powder.
21.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: Calm down. Let's talk this through.
86.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

4.speaker: Philomeen
4.text: What's to say? You're Nere's bootlicker - saw you sail in. A godsdamned True Soul.
4.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

104.speaker: Philomeen
104.text: Better to die in this shit-heap than rot in Moonrise. You want me? Come get me.
104.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: You will not serve Ironhand in death. But you might still serve him in life.
37.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

171.speaker: Philomeen
171.text: What the drugh? You - you know nothing of me, damn it.
171.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

158.speaker: Player
158.text: Laridda sent me. The gnomes need your help.
158.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She has JUST enough fondness for Laridda to be convinced.

121.speaker: Philomeen
121.text: Laridda? Ruddy mind games. I... I know all about your tricks, True Soul.
121.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She has JUST enough fondness for Laridda to be convinced.

114.speaker: Philomeen
114.text: Laridda? Ruddy mind games. I... I know all about your tricks, True Soul.
114.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She has JUST enough fondness for Laridda to be convinced.

131.text: Bugger it all - you moved them.
131.context: CinematicNodeContext: Philomeen sighs and lowers her hand. The flame goes out.

95.text: Bugger it all - you moved them.

182.speaker: Philomeen
182.text: Bugger it all - you moved them.

155.speaker: Philomeen
155.text: Go on, drag me to Moonrise. I'll make you cult-nutters suffer.

140.speaker: Player
140.text: I don't want you. I will take that smokepowder, though.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: What good is a single vial?

172.speaker: Player
172.text: Very generous of you - I accept.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: It sounds valuable. On second thought, I'll take it all.

149.speaker: Player
149.text: Calm down. Beldron's trapped in a cave-in, and I need the smokepowder.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I don't want you. I just wanted the smokepowder.

13.speaker: Philomeen
13.text: Runepowder, you mean. Such a damned waste...

134.speaker: Player
134.text: Calm down. Beldron's trapped in a cave-in, and I needed the smokepowder.

190.speaker: Player
190.text: I'm not taking you anywhere. You're free to go.

91.speaker: Philomeen
91.text: I'm not stupid, you know. No such thing in Grymforge as kind hearts.
91.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

24.speaker: Philomeen
24.text: Spit out what you want and let's be done with it.
24.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: What I want is your help. Beldron's trapped - I need the smokepowder.
32.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

39.speaker: Philomeen
39.text: You want to waste runepowder on -
39.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: How about a little of that smokepowder?
60.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

33.speaker: Philomeen
33.text: You want to barter with runepowder -
33.context: CinematicNodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.NodeContext: Aghast, catches herself.

161.speaker: Philomeen
161.text: Look. You have no idea what you're dealing with. Any true Ironhand would trade their life for a grain of this stuff.
161.context: NodeContext: Steadying her voice and continuing - she was reacting with horror to our ignorance

94.speaker: Philomeen
94.text: It's the whole damn reason we're here, and I'm not leaving without it.
94.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

58.speaker: Philomeen
58.text: But let me go... and maybe I'll spare you a vial.
58.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

196.speaker: Player
196.text: 'Ironhand'. 'Runepowder'. Where have you heard these terms before?
196.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

192.speaker: Narrator
192.text: *Runepowder is gnomish folklore - an explosive of awesome power, handed down to the gnomes by their war-god Gaerdal Ironhand.*

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *Runepowder is gnomish folklore - an explosive of awesome power, handed down to the gnomes by their war-god Gaerdal Ironhand.*

70.speaker: Narrator
70.text: *A formula so dangerous it was stricken from history - if it ever existed to begin with.*

115.text: *Vague notions of rumour and myth - nothing solid comes to mind.*

1.speaker: Narrator
1.text: *Vague notions of rumour and myth - nothing solid comes to mind.*

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I'll need to know a little more about your so-called 'mission' before I let you go.
5.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

84.speaker: Philomeen
84.text: Look. We're freedom fighters. We need this powder to a prove a point. To people who really need a point proven to them.

36.speaker: Philomeen
36.text: Let me go, and you'll be on the right side of history - that's all I can say.

40.speaker: Player
40.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a children's story.
40.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

200.speaker: Philomeen
200.text: We've heard the same ones, I bet. A fistful of fire that can turn cities to dust.

178.speaker: Philomeen
178.text: Well it's real, and I need to bring it back to Baldur's Gate. I'd rather my clan were with me, but...

9.speaker: Philomeen
9.text: The mission comes first. A vial's what I can spare you.

156.speaker: Player
156.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a burrow-tale.
156.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

59.speaker: Player
59.text: What use is a single vial?
59.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

203.speaker: Philomeen
203.text: A barrel of this could light up the Underdark. A vial is plenty - just let me go my way.

162.speaker: Player
162.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

211.speaker: Player
211.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

3.speaker: Philomeen
3.text: Don't be stupid. We're parting ways here. Up to you in how many pieces.
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

26.speaker: Player
26.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

163.speaker: Philomeen
163.context: CinematicNodeContext: She tosses the player a vial (throw and catch with hands off-screen, preferably)

67.speaker: Philomeen
67.context: NodeContext: Our business is concluded, but she's mulling over whether to ask us a favour. She's not one to agonise so her own reluctance annoyes her (this leads into 'You see Laridda at the dig?'

153.speaker: Philomeen
153.text: You see Laridda at the dig? Tell her I'm dead. Impaled, half-eaten... I don't care - make up a story.
153.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

12.speaker: Player
12.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

43.speaker: Lae'zel
43.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

80.speaker: Shadowheart
80.text: I'm not sure I blame her. Though Laridda might.
80.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

16.speaker: Karlach
16.text: And I thought I'd heard it all. That's some cambion-level deception.
16.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

75.speaker: Player
75.text: You'd abandon your beloved? That's mighty cruel of you.
75.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: You'd abandon your beloved? That's mighty cruel of you.
53.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

122.speaker: Philomeen
122.text: Beloved? I might have been hers. She sure as hells wasn't mine.
122.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

29.speaker: Philomeen
29.text: I'm getting the runepowder back to Baldur's Gate. Alone.
29.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

123.speaker: Philomeen
123.text: I'm getting gone. You ought to do the same.
123.context: NodeContext: 'The' ponounced with a long E. THE END.

77.speaker: Player
77.context: NodeContext: Calling out to her lover who is not actually there.

19.speaker: Philomeen
19.text: I go where there's shit to stir. And there's no shortage of options.

113.speaker: Player
113.text: Your friends are dead. And you will be too if you don't flee this place.
113.context: NodeContext: Calling out to her lover who is not actually there.

41.speaker: Philomeen
41.text: Dead? Of course. They should have run, had every chance.

150.speaker: Player
150.text: Your friends are freed and gathering across the lake. You should join them.
150.context: NodeContext: Calling out to her lover who is not actually there.

142.speaker: Philomeen
142.text: Friends? Cowards, more like. Gave them a good blast as cover, and they sat on their bony arses. Done for good with them.
142.context: NodeContext: Calling out to her lover who is not actually there.

194.speaker: Player
194.text: I'll pass on the word - right after I kill you.

30.speaker: Philomeen
30.text: I knew I couldn't trust you. Do it, then. Make it hurt.

170.speaker: Player
170.text: Laridda needs you. So does your crew - your burrow.

47.speaker: Philomeen
47.text: Words. I'm about more than that.

197.speaker: Player
197.text: I could tell her I ate you. Think she'd believe me?

31.speaker: Player
31.text: So you'll just leave your clan behind?

99.speaker: Philomeen
99.text: Don't talk of my clan like you understand.

102.speaker: Philomeen
102.text: Just make it work, all right?

129.speaker: Astarion
129.text: Ah, nothing says 'true love' like faking your own death to avoid someone.

68.speaker: Wyll
68.text: She's leaving? Laridda will be heartbroken.

92.speaker: Gale
92.text: She has a heart made of stone, this one - that only smokepowder can break.

105.speaker: Philomeen
105.text: ... it's gone? You damned rat. I knew I couldn't trust you!

103.speaker: Player
103.text: I want nothing from you, I swear.

17.speaker: Player
17.text: Your head. It will make a nice souvenir.

108.speaker: Philomeen
108.text: 'Course I am. You got the runepowder. So now you cut and run.

191.speaker: Philomeen
191.text: It's the whole damn reason we're here.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: The powder's 'the reason you're here'? How so?

138.speaker: Player
138.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a burrow-tale.

120.speaker: Philomeen
120.text: Well, it's real, and I need to bring it back to Baldur's Gate.

118.speaker: Philomeen
118.text: A vial's all I got left. And I'm not parting with it for nothing.

87.speaker: Philomeen
87.text: A vial's all I got... wait...

168.speaker: Player
168.text: 'Runepowder'? I thought that was a children's story.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Fine - I've heard all I need.

179.speaker: Player
179.text: I'd rather have the pleasure of killing you with my own hands.

166.text: Laridda? Drugning mind games. I know all about your tricks, True Soul.

57.speaker: Philomeen
57.text: Laridda? Drugning mind games. I know all about your tricks, True Soul.

164.speaker: Philomeen
164.text: Gaerdal Ironhand, hear me now - set me free!
164.context: NodeContext: About to blow herself up, thinking she is dying an honorable death.

73.speaker: Player
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda prepares to fling her spell. Transition to gameplay: Laridda fires the spell and blows herself up.

205.speaker: Wyll
205.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda prepares to fling her spell. Transition to gameplay: Laridda fires the spell and blows herself up.

63.speaker: Player
63.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda prepares to fling her spell. Transition to gameplay: Laridda fires the spell and blows herself up.

143.context: CinematicNodeContext: Laridda prepares to fling her spell. Transition to gameplay: Laridda fires the spell and blows herself up.

165.speaker: Player
165.text: If I was a True Soul, you'd be dead. Stand down before you hurt yourself.
165.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

195.speaker: Philomeen
195.text: Not a True Soul? And I'm - I'm supposed to believe that?
195.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

65.speaker: Philomeen
65.text: Not a True Soul? And I'm - I'm supposed to believe that?
65.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

174.text: Drugnin' liars. Wouldn't know truth if it slapped you broadside.

187.speaker: Philomeen
187.text: Drugnin' liars. Wouldn't know truth if it slapped you broadside.

188.speaker: Player
188.text: KILL THE FIRE. OR DIE. PAINFULLY.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: Smile sincerely and hold out your hand.
27.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

18.speaker: Philomeen
18.text: Don't do this. Don't pretend you - you give a shit about me.
18.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

119.speaker: Philomeen
119.text: Don't do this. Don't pretend you - you give a shit about me.
119.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

22.text: Oh, for... I'm gonna blow, and you're getting chummy? Drugh off, prickslit.

117.speaker: Philomeen
117.text: Oh, for... I'm gonna blow, and you're getting chummy? Drugh off, prickslit.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Are you sure about this? Once you're dead, that's it. It's over.
11.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

109.speaker: Philomeen
109.text: Damned nutter. You - you think I fear death?
109.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

181.speaker: Philomeen
181.text: Damned nutter. You - you think I fear death?
181.context: NodeContext: Said with some doubt in her voice. She believes you JUST enough.

50.text: Now you're getting it. I'd sooner walk the Hells than be tortured at Moonrise!

88.speaker: Philomeen
88.text: Now you're getting it. I'd sooner walk the Hells than be tortured at Moonrise!

71.speaker: Player
71.context: NodeContext: Creepy sounding. She is taking pleasure in her murder-suicide.

208.speaker: Philomeen
208.text: Gaerdal Ironhand, I have lived for you, and now I'll die for you!

64.speaker: Philomeen
64.text: Gaerdal Ironhand, I have lived for you, and now I'll die for you!

82.text: I know what you're doing. And it ends, here and now.

198.speaker: Philomeen
198.text: I know what you're doing. And it ends, here and now.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: I don't care. Go on, blow us up.
111.context: NodeContext: Creepy sounding. She is taking pleasure in her murder-suicide.

157.speaker: Philomeen
157.context: NodeContext: Creepy sounding. She is taking pleasure in her murder-suicide.

204.speaker: Player
204.text: You wouldn't dare - you don't have the courage.
204.context: CinematicNodeContext: Philomeen gestures and the flame in her hand briefly sparks even more.

199.speaker: Philomeen
199.context: CinematicNodeContext: Philomeen gestures and the flame in her hand briefly sparks even more.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Holy hells. Have you gone mad?

8.speaker: Philomeen
8.text: Damn right, pecker. Now shut your face before I melt it clean off.

93.speaker: Philomeen
93.text: I know what you are - one of Nere's cult-goons. Sailed right in.

167.speaker: Player
167.text: Look at me - I'm not here to hurt my own.

124.speaker: Philomeen
124.text: I'll do worse to Nere's lapdog, hoon.

110.speaker: Player
110.text: Smokepowder's no toy. Whatever happens to me, it will be far worse for you.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: Do it. I could do with a show.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I'm not here to hurt you. You have my word.

180.speaker: Player
180.text: Raise your hands in a show of peace.

83.speaker: Player
83.text: Don't be dumb. Check your exits - you've got nowhere to go.

202.speaker: Astarion
202.text: Easy now, let's not do anything hilarious.
202.context: NodeContext: Gnome is threatening to blow herself up, but Astarion is pretty sure he'll survive the blast

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: Hells. Whatever you do, don't set her off.
72.context: NodeContext: He's addressing the gnome, not the player.

135.speaker: Gale
135.text: As an expert on the subject, my dear lady - I'd like to point out that blowing oneself up is never the solution.
135.context: NodeContext: He's addressing the gnome, not the player.

210.speaker: Philomeen
210.text: Get moving. I'll be doing the same.
